Fields.DialogueText: Engine room! Give me ramming speed! All gunners, blow up anything that gets in our way! We're going to give these Morganas a KO punch!
@BATTLE
And the champion is... the U.S.S. Salt Lake City!
Along with the bravest Captain the world has ever known! Hey, do you think they have root beer in New Zealand? I'm parched!
I know one way to find out.
Some Time Later
And we're docked. After that fight, I'm sure you're ready to take a breather.
Actually, I know I should be exhausted and everything, but I'm actually quite energized. Must be all the adrenaline.
Just be careful. You know what they say. What goes up, must come down.
Especially after they get a taste of my right hook.
Hey, careful where you're throwing those punches. Who will buy you root beer if I'm knocked unconscious?
Oh, I'm sure there'd be a crewman to fetch everything we need for a party.
A party? What for?
Well, we need to celebrate. After a big win, the celebration is one of the best parts.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not so sure that's the best use of our time.
A party sounds fun. I'm in.
You sure you're in the best shape for a party?

Fields.DialogueText: We have plenty of time. The Morganas will be there after we're done having a little fun.
That's what I like to hear. Who doesn't like a party?
Maybe not the best shape, but right now I'm floating on cloud nine. Let me enjoy all this before I start to feel all the aches and bruises.
All right. What else are we going to need for this little party?
Oh, I've got a list.
Hey, Captain. Did you find all the party supplies?
I did. All except for one thing.
What couldn't you find?

Fields.MenuText: My dignity. I lost it somewhere around the second piñata.
This thing... root beer... is that how you pronounce it? I couldn't find it anywhere.
A bag big enough to hold everything. I needed an army to hold all these supplies.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, don't be so dramatic.
You're joking right?
Heh, well, isn't it better to have something and not need it than need it and not have it?
So you did get everything? Great.
Yes. It's all getting set up in the mess as we speak.
Oh, I should go help them!
Have you taken a second to catch your breath yet?
I'm breathing just fine, thank you very much.
You know, there was a moment I was worried Malice was going to show up in fighting form.
Gee, thanks.
I'm just saying it came pretty close. And now you're throwing yourself into this party stuff. You've earned a rest, Saltshaker.
*ALARM*
Tell that to them.
Worst timing ever, Morganas.
@BATTLE
Looking good, right, Captain? I think we're about ready to party!
It's looking good. Though I'm still not quite sure why you're hanging up chicken piñatas.
Well, they don't have Morgana pinatas. These will be close enough after- Oh, woah!
*Stumble & fall*
Salt Lake City! Are you okay?!
I'm fine. I just fell off a step ladder. It's not like I fell overboard.
Don't you think it might be time for a nap now?
You're still on about that? I appreciate the worry, Captain, but I'm not some delicate lily.
Fighting Malice was pretty bad, but I've been in worse before and I'll probably face even worse soon enough. You don't have to worry about me.

Fields.MenuText: You're right... I'm sure you can take care of yourself.
I don't have to, but I'm going to.
I'll believe you when you can get off a step ladder without falling on your butt.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. I can take care of myself quite well. I don't need you to do it for me.
Well, I guess I can't stop you. Just don't come crying to me when I'm perfectly fine.
If I had the time, I'd step up and down this ladder all day. I wouldn't break a sweat!
Now, if you'll excuse me, duty calls. We've got a patrol to make. It wouldn't do to have our fun interrupted.
Should I stay behind you in case you fall again?
Ha. Ha. You're hilarious.
@BATTLE
Let's knock ‘em out so we can get to the party!
@BATTLE
Hey, Saltshaker, what are you doing over here? The party's in the mess.
I know, Captain. I'll get there soon, I'm just grabbing some ice. My little adrenaline burst is finally starting to wear off.

Fields.MenuText: Well, you got a lot more on her.
Do we need to book you a bed in the infirmary?
Ice? Aren't you supposed to use heat?

Fields.DialogueText: I did indeed, but honestly, it was a closer fight than I would've prefered.
No, that won't be necessary. If I was that worried, I'd already be there.
You alternate. This wasn't my first fight. I know how to do this.
I'm just glad you're not acting like everything is fine. You need to take care of yourself after a fight like that.
I know, Captain, I know... It really was an epic fight though, wasn't it?
Definitely one for the record books. It's too bad we couldn't sell tickets.
Ha, I'm sure tons of people would've paid good money to see that knock out punch.
There's always next time.
Jokes aside, I don't fight to make money, Captain.
Dempsey did.
Dempsey boxed for a living, I... well, I'm a warship for a living. It's different.
We can argue about this all night, but let's get to the party first. You put a lot of effort into it, it's only right you get to enjoy it.
Okay, let's just hope I can ignore these aches and pains long enough to have a little fun.
Saltshaker! This has been an amazing party, doll! I wasn't so sure you knew what a party was at first!
I'm glad you're enjoying yourself, Captain. Though, I fear you may be enjoying yourself a little too much.
What do you mean?
Might be time for you to stop drinking.

Fields.MenuText: I haven't had a single drop. I'm just enjoying myself.
I may have had one or two drinks, but I wouldn't say I'm canned.
I've only had tee martoonis... Wait, dat dishn't come out right.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, really? That makes two of us then.
They must've been some pretty strong drinks.
No, I think you meant to say two martinis. Which just proves how drunk you actually are.
You know, if anyone here actually deserves to have a drink, it's you.
Oh, I've had plenty to drink. See, I've got a full glass right here.
Yeah, but that's root beer. I'm talking about the real stuff.
You know I don't drink, Captain.
Not even one sip?
Are you trying to tempt my faith, Captain?
That depends on if it's working.
Not at all.
*ALARM*
Well, you know a party's over when the Morganas show up.
Let's hope the crew is sober enough to handle a fight.
There's nothing more sobering than an explosion rocking the ship.
@BATTLE
Hey, Saltshaker, I was wondering something.
Is it about cleaning the mess? Don't worry, I've got it handled.
No. That is a good question, though.
Don't worry about it. What were you wondering?
I was pondering what you'd think about taking a little vacation, after all we've been through.
A vacation? What for?

Fields.MenuText: No reason. Any excuse to take a break, right?
You can't tell me you're not exhausted after dealing with them.
I think you've earned it.

Fields.DialogueText: I think we need to work on your work ethic, Captain.
Maybe a little, but I think I'll be fine after a good night's rest.
I've earned it? Well, thanks, Captain. I guess you might be right.
Where would we even go for vacation? The entire world is at war right now.
I'm sure we could find somewhere to catch our breath for a bit. Just think about it, Saltshaker.
I will. I'll get back to you.
@BATTLE
Hey, Captain, I've been thinking about that whole vacation thing.
I'm not sure I like the way you said that. You're turning me down, ain't ya?
I just don't feel right about taking a break like that while the Morganas are running amok.

Fields.MenuText: You're right. The Morganas aren't taking a vacation.
They'll still be here when we get back.
Excellent word choice. You don't hear "amok" enough these days.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. Now, if the Morganas ever do go on vacation, then we can talk.
I'm more worried about who wouldn't be here when we got back.
Well, you're not wrong.
I hear you loud and clear. We'll defeat all the Morganas, then go on a nice vacation.
Setting your sights pretty high there, aren't you, Captain?
Only one way to find out. Let's go find some unlucky Morganas to blow up.
@BATTLE
Hey, Saltshaker, no one in the ring with you today? Did you scare away the whole crew?
Maybe. You beat a few of them and the rest go running. I'm beginning to think I should've gone easy on them.

Fields.MenuText: That might've kept them around a little longer.
You'd throw a match?
Never go easy. If you're not going to do your best, then what's the point?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe, but eventually I'd get bored of taking it easy. It's more fun to go all out.
I wouldn't throw the match, but I could make them think they have a chance of winning.
You and I see eye to eye once again, Captain.
What do you say to getting in the ring with me?
You want to go a match with me?
Just a friendly match. It'd just be a fun little warm up fight.
*ALARM*
Well, if you want a warm up, I think we can find you a better target than my face.
It's not as fun. None of them will get in the ring with me like Malice did.
@BATTLE
Hey, Saltshaker. Busy with the good book?
Just finishing up. What do you need?
I was thinking about when you challenged me to box.
Oh? Are you warming up to the idea?
If we make it interesting.
You mean a bet? I put gambling where I put my alcohol and my caffeine, Captain.
Oh, I didn't realize Mormons didn't like gambling.
Well, I'm not suggesting we put money on the table.
Hmmm, that might be okay. What are you thinking?
The winner gets to make the loser do something embarrassing.
You realize I'm going to win, right?

Fields.MenuText: Don't get too cocky. Everyone loves an underdog.
Sure you are. Keep telling yourself that.
You're gonna eat my dust.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's see how much they love you when I make you walk around in your underwear for a day.
I will. I'll keep telling myself that until I make you eat all the expired food in the mess.
This isn't a race. Unless you're going to run out of the ring and make me winner by default.
I'm in. This is going to be hilarious.
Yes. Yes, it is. I'm going to make you turn beet-red out of embarrassment.
*ALARM*
Just in time to ruin my good mood.
You'll be in a better one after we beat them.
You're right about that.
@BATTLE
Hey, Saltshaker, have you noticed that there have been more Morganas attacking us lately?
More Morganas? There seem to be just as many as before.
Maybe... It feels like they're attacking us more than they used to.
Is this some round about way of trying to get out of our fight? I'm not letting you get off that easy.

Fields.MenuText: Alright, you caught me.
No, I'm being serious.
Actually, I totally forgot about our fight.

Fields.DialogueText: It's too late to get cold feet, Captain. If you quit now, then I win by default.
Really? Then I guess we should be keeping our eyes out a little more.
No you didn't! We just agreed to the terms! How can you be so forgetful?
*ALARM*
See? This is what I'm talking about.
Morganas attack us all the time.
Yeah, but when was the last time we've managed to avoid a conflict?
Hmmm... Well, not this time. Come on, time to fight, Captain!
@BATTLE
Getting a little more practice in before our match? You're going to need it.
So confident! Honestly, Captain, I didn't even realize you had any boxing experience.

Fields.MenuText: I don't. Beginner's Luck, Salt Lake City.
I've had some time in the ring. Nowhere near as much as you though.
I was practically born in the ring.

Fields.DialogueText: Beginner's Luck? That's what you're counting on to win our match?! Boy, are you in trouble.
Well, not many people have.
That makes two of us, at least in spirit. I was technically born in a shipyard.
So when are we finally going to do this thing?
The sooner the better, I say.
*ALARM*
How about right after we deal with these Morganas?
We can have a chance to catch our breath first, right?
Fine. I wouldn't want you to complain later about fighting with a handicap.
You are way too full of yourself right now.
@BATTLE
Is everyone here to watch our fight?
I spread the word a little.
What did you do, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I made a few flyers and passed em around the crew.
I told people, those people told people, and so on and so forth.
I told a few people. I wanted to keep it small. Guess that didn't work out.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, is that all?!
Yes, I understand the phrase "spread the word." What I don't get is why.
No, it clearly did not. There must be half the ship here.
If I had known our fight would be such a public spectacle, I'd have put a little more work into it.
What do you mean?
I could've put on a bit of a show, you know? It's a little late for that, I guess.
A little. As soon as that bell rings, we're going to be talking with our fists.
Let's hope you're not mute.
Very funny.
*ALARM*
That's a weird sounding bell.
That's because it's the alarm. We're getting attacked by Morganas.
Again? We just fought some off.
I guess I was right, huh? There's more than normal.
We can worry about that once we take care of these ones.
@BATTLE
So we're in agreement now, right? There's too many Morganas attacking us for it to be normal.
Yeah. It's like they're targeting us. Or maybe they're attracted to us.

Fields.MenuText: I don't know. Who knows what a Morgana is thinking?
They must be targeting us. But why?
Could they be attracted to us? Could it be our smell?

Fields.DialogueText: Besides another Morgana? No one.
Did we do something to anger them? Besides beating them up every chance we get, of course.
Are you saying I smell, Captain? I think I smell pretty good for a heavy cruiser.
What do we do? Besides continue to fight them off.
I might have a plan. It'll at least confirm our suspicions.
Okay, that's a start. What is it?
*ALARM*
Well, it starts with defeating these Morganas, and then running as fast as we can.
I don't run from a fight, Captain.
No, no, we're going to win the fight, then we're going to run.
Oh... That's better.
@BATTLE
We're in the middle of nowhere. Why?
Well, if we are attacked in the middle of nowhere, then we're being hunted.
Or it's a coincidence.

Fields.MenuText: I don't believe in coincidences.
Don't rain on my plan.
Well, I guess that could be it too...

Fields.DialogueText: That sounded too cool. Did you practice that in the mirror?
Okay, fine. It's a good plan. Let's just see if it works.
We might need a different plan.
Captain, we have Morganas on approach.
Already?
That was surprisingly fast. Where are they coming from?
They seem to be following in our wake. I'm not sure how long they've been on our trail though.
They followed us! See, my plan worked!
Okay, celebrate later. We've got a fight to get ready for now.
@BATTLE
It has to be Malice behind this, right?
I'm sorry, what?
The reason all these Morganas are coming after us. It has to be Malice sending them, right?

Fields.MenuText: It could be. She seemed like the kind of person to hold a grudge.
You beat her soundly. I doubt she'd want to hurry into another battle with you.
Who?

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. We also know she's the kind of person who'd do anything to win.
You're forgetting that the first time we tangled, I was the one on the floor.
Malice. The Morgana I boxed? The one we... *sigh* We really need to work on your memory.
I don't know. I just feel like she might be trying to soften me up with all these Morganas.
Soften you up for what?
For a rematch. Technically, we are tied right now. She might want to make it best two out of three.
If that's the case, we'd better hurry to port. If Malice could be around any corner, I'd rather our stock be overflowing.
You and me both, Captain. Let's see just how low we can sit in the water without sinking.
Let's not go that far, Swayback Maru.
@BATTLE
We're approaching port, Captain.
Just in time. All these Morganas are really draining our supplies.
Weakening us for our final confrontation with Malice.

Fields.MenuText: I'm still not completely sold that this is Malice's doing.
One word I'd never use to describe you is weak, Salt Lake City.
Well, it's working. I'm feeling pretty vulnerable right now.

Fields.DialogueText: If you have another explanation, I'd love to hear it.
Thanks, Captain. Though I'm going to need more than your confidence in me to take on Malice again.
You shouldn't. Now that we know what she's up to. We can prepare.
*BOOM*
What was that?
Morganas! They're surrounding us. They came out of nowhere.
They must've been lying in wait for us.
Captain... doesn't that ship in the distance look like Malice?
Focus on the Morganas at the forefront for now, Saltshaker.
You're right, but I'm going to keep an eye on that ship. If that is Malice, we can't let her get away.
@BATTLE
Let's make this fast. We need to resupply and get back on the water before Malice gets too far out.
Yes, ma'am.
I don't want to see anyone slacking. Anyone I catch not giving this a hundred percent is getting pulled in the ring with me!
I'll be sure to spread the word.
Threatening your own crew now?
It's not a threat. It's a promise. Do you disapprove?

Fields.MenuText: No, just try not to hurt anyone too badly.
I will if you fight them before we get to have our match.
I'd rather the crew not be afraid of you.

Fields.DialogueText: It'd just be training, Captain. They might even learn a thing or two.
Oh, you're right. We never got to have our fight! One more reason to hurry up and take down Malice.
They're not afraid of me, I hope... You think they're afraid of me?
Captain, we should be ready to take off before long. Do we have a destination in mind?
We need to go after that ship I saw in the distance. I'm sure it was Malice.
You heard the lady.
Yes, Captain.
You're sure it was Malice?
Positive. We'll find out soon enough.
Let's get this resupply moving!
@BATTLE
Malice just won't quit, huh? How many times do you think we're going to have to defeat her before she stays down?
You know, she might not have the best motives, but I have to respect her a little.
Respect her for what?
For getting back up. We took her down pretty hard. There aren't a lot of people who would rush head first into a fight with someone they lost to.

Fields.MenuText: She's not a person. She's a Morgana.
Sounds like a stupid plan to me.
That does take a fair amount of guts.

Fields.DialogueText: And I'm a Belle. It's semantics, Captain.
You might be right. At least until it works and she defeats us.
Exactly. Her tactics may be questionable, but she's got a fighter's resolve.
You might respect her for getting up and fighting again, but you shouldn't forget that she plays dirty.
Oh, trust me. I remember the first time we fought. I won't be knocked down so easily.
*ALARM*
That's good to hear, because we've got company.
Malice can't think that I'll fall to these grunts. Keep an eye out for her, Captain. She could show up at any moment.
Will do.
@BATTLE
Salt Lake City, I've got good news.
Can it wait? I just sat down to read a little.
Normally I'd leave you to your passages, but you're going to want to hear this.
Okay... I'll read later. What's going on?
We've received a location for Malice. She's not too far.
How did we get her location so easily?
You're thinking it might be a trap.
Don't you?

Fields.MenuText: No. The thought never crossed my mind.
Yeah, it could be a trap...
But now that we know it's a trap, is it really a trap?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that doesn't bode well for our future engagements with the Morganas.
Then again, I could just be overthinking it...
Hmmm... Now that's a thinker.
You know, trap or not, we have to go.
Why?
Because we don't have many other leads. If we're lucky, when we trigger this trap of hers, she'll be there to watch. Then we'll have our chance to strike.
If you're sure. I hope we don't end up regretting this.
You and me both, Captain.
@BATTLE
This is the location. She should be right here.
Keep your eyes open, Captain. Morganas could be coming from any angle.

Fields.MenuText: Eyes on the horizon, crew.
Don't discount anything. I want eyes everywhere.

Fields.DialogueText: If she's sending ships after us, we should be able to spot them a mile away.
If she's sending ships after us, we should be able to spot them a mile away.
*BOOM*
Malice must've doubled down on this trap of hers.
We have Morganas closing in from every direction. She's covered all her bases.
What do we do now? We're surrounded and taking fire.
We do what we came here to do. Win.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Don't discount submarines, either.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry. I'm watching my footwork, so to speak.
I think that's the last of them.
How many waves of Morganas does Malice have at her disposal?!
As many as it takes.
It's good to see you survived. If you had been defeated easily, I'd have been insulted.
Finally you show yourself! Are you done softening me up with all these small fry?
I was just making sure you were worth my time.
You're sure you're not still sore about losing before?
You got lucky. Now it's time for a tiebreaking match.
You want to get back in the ring? Let's go, I'm ready for you!
Oh, please. Why bother fighting with our fists when I can blow you up instead? I won't be happy until your entire ship is in pieces.
You think I might've egged her on a little too much, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: No, I liked it.
Maybe a little, but she had it coming.
Yes. I'm not sure we really needed her any angrier.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Well, feel free to join in next time.
She did, didn't she?
I'm not afraid of her. We're going to come out on top, Captain.
She's approaching, Saltshaker. I hope you're ready for this tiebreaker.
Let's settle the score.
@BATTLE
Ooof! Malice got me breathing hard.
Saltshaker, are you alright!?
We're not done here yet.

Fields.MenuText: You don't look good.
Get back in there and take her down.
Are you sure you can handle this?

Fields.DialogueText: Gee, thanks. Such a charmer, Captain.
You don't have to tell me twice!
I'm positive. I'm not giving up now!
If things start looking grim, I will throw in the towel and get us the hell out of here.
No you won't! You have nothing to worry about. I'm going to win!
How can you be so sure? Right now, the smart money is on her.
I don't gamble, but if I did, I'd bet on the underdog.
Come on! Round two, Malice!
Just try not to die, Salt Lake City!
@BATTLE
Time for the final haymaker!
@BATTLE
You did it! You won!
Just look at Malice, slinking off with her tail between her legs.
Should we finish her off? It'd only take a few good shots.
No. Maybe she won't come back as angry if we show her a little mercy.
This isn't the last you've seen of me! I will destroy you and prove that I'm the strongest. Just wait!
Or not.

Fields.MenuText: Empty threats. That's all they are.
So... torpedoes?
Are you afraid?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I wouldn't say empty. I'm sure this won't be our last fight.
No, there's no point. We'll need those torpedoes for the next fight.
A little, but I'm also looking forward to it. That's a little odd, isn't it?
It sounds like you may have made your first nemesis.
Huh, I guess we are rivals now. I'm looking forward to our next grudge match.
So, Captain, we defeated Malice. You know what's next, right?

Fields.MenuText: Another party?
A vacation? Finally?
I'm guessing you want to finish our fight.

Fields.DialogueText: No, but a couple more piñatas does sound like a plan. And I could always go for some more root beer.
No. Stop it with the vacation talk. We can rest when the Morganas rest.
Finish? We never even got to start!
Malice's Morganas interrupted our fight before it even began. I didn't even get to see your form or anything.
You have such a one track mind sometimes, you know?
I prefer to think of that as a positive character trait.
Okay, I'll need a bit to get the crew together to watch.
No audience this time. You're coming with me and we're going to have a nice private match.
Wait, you mean right now?
I can think of no better time.
But what if some, I don't know, Morganas show up or something!?
They can wait. For now, you're all mine, Captain.
And don't forget, when you lose you have to do whatever embarrassing thing I say.
@BATTLE
Right after we deal with some of Malice's friends coming over the horizon...
I can't believe you actually did this.
Oh, calm down. You look pretty good in pink.
Uh, what's with the new uniform, Captain?
Salt Lake City dyed all my clothes pink.
Why?
Don't ask.
Oh relax, there's so many worse things I could've done, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Name one.
I guess you're right.
No. There's nothing worse. I look horrible in pink.

Fields.DialogueText: I could've made you go around the ship and hug every member of the crew. That would've taken you the better part of a day, for sure.
That's a better way to look at it. Keep your chin up.
I think you pull it off quite well.
Well, I've learned a lesson. Never challenge you in the ring.
Now if only Malice would learn that lesson too.
Make her wear this next time and maybe she will.
Ohhh, that's not the worst idea. I'll try it next time.
Now, let's hurry back home. I need a less embarrassing uniform.
